name: PROTéGé
author: Alex Mair
description:
PROTéGé is a minimalistic tabletop role-playing game. There are only two
abilities (in contrast to the 6-7 found in most role-playing games),
ten spells,

There is only one and only die type in PROTéGé: the d6. PROTéGé is
computationally intensive, making it ideal for computer-based simulators of
role-playing games; indeed PROTéGé definitely fits the role of a "roll-playing"
game over a "role-playing" game.

Whilst PROTéGé is meant to be playable (afterall, it would be rather pointless
to simulate if it weren't), it is certainly not tested in any real
sense. It is mostly a proof of concept for dmclient to test a variety of
features. Thus you may want to actually play PROTéGé if you allow dmclient to
simulate its features.
